titles: An Egley [sic] upon the most execrable murther of Mr. Clun on [sic] of the comedeans of the Theator [sic] Royal, who was rob'd and most inhumanely kill'd on Tuseday-night [sic], being the 2d, of August, 1664. near Tatnam-Court, as he was riding to his country-house at Kentishtown.
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Mourn royal stage, your poets pens implore ..."
Imperfect: badly stained, affecting text and imprint.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Clun, Walter, d. 1664 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
